citation.article-title: Flavobacterium daejeonense sp. nov. and Flavobacterium suncheonense sp. nov., isolated from greenhouse soils in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium suncheonense sp. nov.
Flavobacterium suncheonense (sun.cheon.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. suncheonense pertaining to Suncheon, a city in Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Growth occurs at 15–37 °C, pH 6–8 and 0–1 % NaCl.
Colonies are yellow, convex and round with clear margins.
Catalase and oxidase tests are positive.
Gelatin, casein, tyrosine and egg yolk are degraded, but starch, cellulose, agar, alginate, pectin, chitin, aesculin and DNA are not.

Positive reaction for gelatin hydrolysis, but negative reactions for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, aseculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase (API 20NE).
Does not assimilate all carbohydrates tested (API 20NE).

Enzymic activity is detected for alkaline phosphatase, esterase C4, esterase lipase C8, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase (API ZYM).

No activity is detected for lipase C14, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase (API ZYM).
No acids are produced from all the substrates tested (API 50CH).
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 (29.9 %), iso-C17 : 0 3-OH (17.7 %), iso-C15 : 1 G (12.0 %) and iso-C15 : 0 3-OH (11.1 %).
The sole quinone is MK-6, and the G+C content is 39 mol%.
The type strain, GH29-5T (=KACC 11423T=DSM 17707T), was isolated from greenhouse soil, Suncheon city, Republic of Korea.
